title: Printing directory trees with printtree
text: project = “root”, printtree can walk upward provided path detect project root using simple markers. default includes: .Rproj files (RStudio / Posit projects) DESCRIPTION files (R package roots) example, mark demo package-like root creating DESCRIPTION file, print subdirectory: can customize detection using rootmarkers:
code: file.create(file.path(demo, "DESCRIPTION")) #> [1] TRUE subdir <- file.path(demo, "data", "raw") print_rtree(subdir, project = "root") #> printtree-demo/ #> |-- data/ #> |   `-- raw/ #> |-- R/ #> |   `-- hello.R #> |-- DESCRIPTION #> `-- README.md print_rtree(subdir, project = "root", root_markers = c(".Rproj", "DESCRIPTION", "_quarto.yml")) #> printtree-demo/ #> |-- data/ #> |   `-- raw/ #> |-- R/ #> |   `-- hello.R #> |-- DESCRIPTION #> `-- README.md

title: printtree
text: printtree prints compact directory tree R projects folder. can optionally detect project roots associated common R workflows (e.g., RStudio projects via .Rproj files) print tree appropriate root directory. snapshot tree directory can generated using snapshot feature. package IDE-agnostic: project metadata detected, simply prints directory tree specified folder.

title: printtree
code: library(printtree)  # Current working directory print_rtree()  # Explicit path print_rtree("~/Projects/myproj")  # Project name (searched in search_paths) print_rtree("myproj", search_paths = c("~/Projects", "~/Documents"))  # Limit depth print_rtree(max_depth = 2)  # Unicode tree (if your terminal supports it) print_rtree(format = "unicode")  # Save a PNG snapshot print_rtree(snapshot = TRUE)  # Dark background snapshot print_rtree(snapshot = TRUE, snapshot_bg = "black", snapshot_file = "tree-dark.png")  #or White background with dark text print_rtree(snapshot = TRUE, snapshot_bg = "white", snapshot_file = "tree-white.png")

title: printtree
text: project = “root”, printtree can walk upward given path detect project root using simple markers: .Rproj files (RStudio / Posit projects) DESCRIPTION files (R package roots) behavior can customized using root_markers argument. project root detected, tree printed provided path.
code: # Detect R package root (DESCRIPTION) print_rtree(project = "root")  # Include Quarto projects print_rtree(project = "root",             root_markers = c(".Rproj", "DESCRIPTION", "_quarto.yml"))

title: printtree
text: Default output uses ASCII portability. Hidden files excluded unless show_hidden = TRUE.

what: Print an R Project or Directory Tree — print_rtree
title: Print an R Project or Directory Tree — print_rtree
text: Prints directory tree given path. Optionally, detects RStudio project (.Rproj) can print project root.

title: Print an R Project or Directory Tree — print_rtree
code: print_rtree(   path = NULL,   ignore = c("renv", ".git", ".Rproj.user", "__pycache__", ".DS_Store", "node_modules",     ".Rhistory"),   max_depth = NULL,   show_hidden = FALSE,   project = c("auto", "root", "none"),   search_paths = c(".", "..", "~/Documents", "~/Projects"),   root_markers = c(".Rproj", "DESCRIPTION"),   format = c("ascii", "unicode"),   return_lines = FALSE,   snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_file = "tree.png",   snapshot_width = 800,   snapshot_bg = c("white", "black") )

title: Print an R Project or Directory Tree — print_rtree
text: path Character. Directory path, project name, .Rproj file. NULL, uses current directory. ignore Character vector. Basenames exclude (e.g., ".git", "renv"). max_depth Integer. Maximum depth traverse. NULL unlimited. show_hidden Logical (TRUE/FALSE). Whether include hidden files/directories (starting "."). project One "auto", "root", "none". "auto": use path -(upward search) "root": walk upward path find project root (via root_markers) use found "none": never attempt root detection; print tree path search_paths Character vector. Used path existing directory (treated project name). Paths searched order. root_markers Character vector. Markers used project = "root" detect root directory. Special value ".Rproj" means "file ending .Rproj". Common markers include "DESCRIPTION" (R package root) "_quarto.yml" (Quarto project root). format One "ascii" "unicode". "ascii" portable terminals. return_lines Logical. TRUE, invisibly return printed character vector lines. snapshot Logical. TRUE, gives visual snapshot tree. snapshot_file Text. Snapshot PNG name snapshot set TRUE. snapshot_width Integer. Default set 800. snapshot_bg Either white black snapshot background. white, tree text appears black vice.

title: Print an R Project or Directory Tree — print_rtree
text: Invisible NULL, character vector printed lines return_lines = TRUE.

title: Print an R Project or Directory Tree — print_rtree
code: # Print tree for current working directory print_rtree() #> reference/ #> |-- figures/ #> |   |-- favicon.ico #> |   `-- favicon.png #> |-- index.html #> `-- print_rtree.html   # Print tree for a specific path # print_rtree("~/Projects/myproj")  # Treat input as project name (searched in search_paths) # print_rtree("myproj")  # Limit depth # print_rtree(max_depth = 2)  # Use unicode tree glyphs (if your terminal supports them) # print_rtree(format = "unicode")  # Use R package root detection (DESCRIPTION) when walking upward # print_rtree(project = "root", root_markers = c(".Rproj", "DESCRIPTION"))

title: printtree 0.2.0
text: Added optional PNG snapshot export via snapshot = TRUE, light/dark backgrounds. Improved project root detection using root_markers (e.g., .Rproj DESCRIPTION). Improved project lookup accept .Rproj filenames project names search_paths.
